alert.note: Alert for Adams; Franklin; Harlan; Kearney; Nuckolls; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 8:29PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jewell, northern Smith, northeastern Phillips, Franklin, Webster, southwestern Adams, southeastern Kearney and eastern Harlan Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 829 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Franklin County. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Red Cloud, Franklin, Hildreth, Campbell, Bladen, Guide Rock, Republican City, Upland, Naponee, Bloomington, Riverton, Huntley, Norman, Cowles, Inavale and Harlan County Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Franklin; Harlan; Kearney; Nuckolls; Webster
